newsitem.title: FRANCE: French consumption up 2.4 pct in 1996 - Lamassoure.
newsitem.headline: French consumption up 2.4 pct in 1996 - Lamassoure.

text.p: French household consumption rose 2.4 percent in 1996, the largest increase since 1990, government spokesman and budget minister Alain Lamassoure said in a radio interview on Tuesday.

Speaking on Radio Monte Carlo, Lamassoure said: "We have figures ... which show the elements of an economic rebound are there. For example ... household consumption was in 1996 at its highest level since 1990, it rose by 2.4 percent."
He said housing sales had revived, exports had never been so good and the government thought exports would improve further this year.

"The growth factor which has been most lacking recently is business investment. If the stock market is rising fast, it is because it is anticipating investment because companies made profits in 1996," he said.
"That will give them the room to invest and therefore create jobs," he added.
